descriptionHtml:
UPDATE PLAN: I'm hoping to add a mechanic to this mod that addresses the description of the enchantment as well as making it so that the player must use the Skyforge to "merge" the masks together. Makes it seem a little more immersive, as well as less of a cheat item. I'm taking opinions on what people think should be the required smithing level and any required perks.

Simple mod that makes changes to the Konahrik mask. After all the work it took hunting down all eight of the Dragon Priests, I felt that Konahrik had a very weak enchantment. So I set upon the task of taking all the enchantments of the masks and combining them all into Konahrik, while retaining it's own original enchantment.

Once you have collected all eight masks, traveled to Labyrinthian and used the wooden mask to acquire Konahrik then you will truly be a Dragonborn of untold power.

I'm still testing this mod, but the effects should stick. Check your active effects menu and ensure that the following enchantments are in effect:

-KONAHRIK-
Konahrik's Privilege

-HEVNORAAK-
Resist Disease, 100 pts
Resist Poison, 100 pts

-KROSIS-
Fortify Lockpicking, 20% better
Fortify Archery, 20% better
Fortify Alchemy, 20% better

-MOROKEI-
Regenerate Magicka, 100 points

-NAHKRIIN-
Fortify Magicka, 50 pts
Fortify Destruction, cost 20% less
Fortify Restoration, cost 20% less

-OTAR-
Resist Shock, 30 pts
Resist Fire, 30 pts
Resist Frost, 30 pts

-RAHGOT-
Fortify Stamina, 70 pts

-VOKUN-
Fortify Conjuration, 20 pts
Fortify Illusion, 20 pts
Fortify Alteration, 20 pts

-VOLSUNG-
Waterbreathing, 20 pts
Fortify Barter, 20 pts
Fortify Carry Weight, 20 pts

All of the following effects (if active) should show as "Konahrik" rather than their respective masks.
This does not add Dragonborn mask effects. Only vanilla masks are added to Konahrik.
Furthermore, the wooden mask effect has not been added to Konahrik either.
author: Athelos
